answers.answer: Wounds that don't heal can be caused by a variety of reasons including immune disorders.  Generally when healing is delayed or absent, diabetes is suspected rather than cancer.  Bones that have been bruised or broken can take up to a year or longer to get back to normal. Are you are speaking of a bruise that is on the skin that isn't going away and isn't changing?  A bruise is mostly blood that has accumulated under the skin because of burst blood vessels and will go away over time.   Sometimes the blood is a "hemotoma" or blood clot that doesn't  go away and over time becomes permanent.  Bruising isn't usually a "sign" of cancer. If you are fearful of cancer due to bruising (cancers of the blood), you can do a simple CBC blood test to include differentials.  The results of this test would indicate blood disorders of any type, not just cancer. If there are abnormailites, other tests can be ordered to "narrow it down".  If you are fearful of cancers of the bone (lack of healing) a plain xray of the body part will indicate changes in the bone.  If any changes are found, MRI or CT would be ordered to identify the problem.  If you are really fearful of all cancers, and you can afford it, you can request a prescription from your doctor for a CT whole body scan, which will check out abnormalities throughout the entire body and all organ systems.  Insurance doesn't usually cover whole body scans, so you would have to cover the costs out-of-pocket. hope this helps
